channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: In-Context Learning for MIMO Equalization Using Transformer-Based Sequence Models
item.description: In ICL, a decision on a new input is made via a direct mapping of the input and of a few examples from the given task, serving as the task's context, to the output variable.

item.title: Efficient Segmentation with Texture in Ore Images Based on Box-supervised Approach
item.description: At the same time, the ore distribution is stacked, and it is difficult to identify the complete features.

item.title: An Automated Pipeline for Tumour-Infiltrating Lymphocyte Scoring in Breast Cancer
item.description: Tumour-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs) are considered as a valuable prognostic markers in both triple-negative and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) breast cancer.

item.title: Automated Sperm Assessment Framework and Neural Network Specialized for Sperm Video Recognition
item.description: Infertility is a global health problem, and an increasing number of couples are seeking medical assistance to achieve reproduction, at least half of which are caused by men.

item.title: Citation Recommendation on Scholarly Legal Articles
item.description: Citation recommendation is the task of finding appropriate citations based on a given piece of text.

item.title: BanglaBait: Semi-Supervised Adversarial Approach for Clickbait Detection on Bangla Clickbait Dataset
item.description: We expect that this dataset and the detailed analysis and comparison of these clickbait detection models will provide a fundamental basis for future research into detecting clickbait titles in Bengali articles.

item.title: Quantized Distillation: Optimizing Driver Activity Recognition Models for Resource-Constrained Environments
item.description: The framework enhances 3D MobileNet, a neural architecture optimized for speed in video classification, by incorporating knowledge distillation and model quantization to balance model accuracy and computational efficiency.

item.title: Differentiable VQ-VAE's for Robust White Matter Streamline Encodings
item.description: Given the complex geometry of white matter streamlines, Autoencoders have been proposed as a dimension-reduction tool to simplify the analysis streamlines in a low-dimensional latent spaces.

item.title: Anytime-Valid Confidence Sequences for Consistent Uncertainty Estimation in Early-Exit Neural Networks
item.description: Early-exit neural networks (EENNs) facilitate adaptive inference by producing predictions at multiple stages of the forward pass.

item.title: Watermarking Vision-Language Pre-trained Models for Multi-modal Embedding as a Service
item.description: Our extensive experiments on various datasets indicate that the proposed watermarking approach is effective and safe for verifying the copyright of VLPs for multi-modal EaaS and robust against model extraction attacks.

item.title: Leveraging LLMs for Synthesizing Training Data Across Many Languages in Multilingual Dense Retrieval
item.description: Therefore, to study model capabilities across both cross-lingual and monolingual retrieval tasks, we develop SWIM-IR, a synthetic retrieval training dataset containing 33 (high to very-low resource) languages for training multilingual dense retrieval models without requiring any human supervision.

item.title: Reframing Audience Expansion through the Lens of Probability Density Estimation
item.description: Audience expansion has become an important element of prospective marketing, helping marketers create target audiences based on a mere representative sample of their current customer base.

item.title: ChiMed-GPT: A Chinese Medical Large Language Model with Full Training Regime and Better Alignment to Human Preferences
item.description: Recently, the increasing demand for superior medical services has highlighted the discrepancies in the medical infrastructure.

item.title: Hierarchical deep learning-based adaptive time-stepping scheme for multiscale simulations
item.description: Multiscale is a hallmark feature of complex nonlinear systems.

item.title: Interactive Motion Planning for Autonomous Vehicles via Adaptive Interactive MPC
item.description: The ego vehicle solves a joint optimization problem for its motion planning involving costs and coupled constraints of both vehicles and applies its own actions.

item.title: Learning Human Action Recognition Representations Without Real Humans
item.description: To this end, we present, for the first time, a benchmark that leverages real-world videos with humans removed and synthetic data containing virtual humans to pre-train a model.

item.title: 2D Image head pose estimation via latent space regression under occlusion settings
item.description: Head orientation is a challenging Computer Vision problem that has been extensively researched having a wide variety of applications.

item.title: A Time-invariant Network Flow Model for Ride-pooling in Mobility-on-Demand Systems
item.description: The resulting problem structure remains identical to a standard network flow model, a linear problem, which can be solved in polynomial time for a given ride-pooling request assignment.

item.title: Tamil-Llama: A New Tamil Language Model Based on Llama 2
item.description: Language modeling has witnessed remarkable advancements in recent years, with Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT setting unparalleled benchmarks in human-like text generation.

item.title: Deep Fast Vision: A Python Library for Accelerated Deep Transfer Learning Vision Prototyping
item.description: Deep learning-based vision is characterized by intricate frameworks that often necessitate a profound understanding, presenting a barrier to newcomers and limiting broad adoption.

item.title: CFBenchmark: Chinese Financial Assistant Benchmark for Large Language Model
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated great potential in the financial domain.

item.title: Multiscale Neural Operators for Solving Time-Independent PDEs
item.description: Time-independent Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) on large meshes pose significant challenges for data-driven neural PDE solvers.

item.title: Improvements on Uncertainty Quantification for Node Classification via Distance-Based Regularization
item.description: A large number of literature relies on uncertainty quantification to evaluate the reliability of a learning model, which is particularly important for applications of out-of-distribution (OOD) detection and misclassification detection.

item.title: 1-Lipschitz Neural Networks are more expressive with N-Activations
item.description: A crucial property for achieving secure, trustworthy and interpretable deep learning systems is their robustness: small changes to a system's inputs should not result in large changes to its outputs.

item.title: Layer-wise Auto-Weighting for Non-Stationary Test-Time Adaptation
item.description: Given the inevitability of domain shifts during inference in real-world applications, test-time adaptation (TTA) is essential for model adaptation after deployment.

item.title: A Performance-Driven Benchmark for Feature Selection in Tabular Deep Learning
item.description: Academic tabular benchmarks often contain small sets of curated features.

item.title: Flexibility of Integrated Power and Gas Systems: Modeling and Solution Choices Matter
item.description: This requires accurately representing the gas flow physics governed by partial differential equations.

item.title: On the Road with GPT-4V(ision): Early Explorations of Visual-Language Model on Autonomous Driving
item.description: This has been a significant bottleneck, particularly in the development of common sense reasoning and nuanced scene understanding necessary for safe and reliable autonomous driving.

item.title: Inference for Probabilistic Dependency Graphs
item.description: Probabilistic dependency graphs (PDGs) are a flexible class of probabilistic graphical models, subsuming Bayesian Networks and Factor Graphs.

item.title: Personalized Online Federated Learning with Multiple Kernels
item.description: Federated learning enables a group of learners (called clients) to train an MKL model on the data distributed among clients to perform online non-linear function approximation.

item.title: A Deep Learning Method for Simultaneous Denoising and Missing Wedge Reconstruction in Cryogenic Electron Tomography
item.description: Tomograms reconstructed with conventional methods, such as filtered back-projection, suffer from the noise, and from artifacts and anisotropic resolution due to the missing wedge of information.

item.title: Outlier-Robust Wasserstein DRO
item.description: Geometric uncertainty due to sampling or localized perturbations of data points is captured by Wasserstein DRO (WDRO), which seeks to learn a model that performs uniformly well over a Wasserstein ball centered around the observed data distribution.

item.title: PolyMaX: General Dense Prediction with Mask Transformer
item.description: Despite this shift, methods based on the per-pixel prediction paradigm still dominate the benchmarks on the other dense prediction tasks that require continuous outputs, such as depth estimation and surface normal prediction.

item.title: Data Valuation and Detections in Federated Learning
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) enables collaborative model training without sharing raw data, demanding abundant, high-quality data for optimal model performance.

item.title: LCM-LoRA: A Universal Stable-Diffusion Acceleration Module
item.description: Latent Consistency Models (LCMs) have achieved impressive performance in accelerating text-to-image generative tasks, producing high-quality images with minimal inference steps.

item.title: Real-time Control of Electric Autonomous Mobility-on-Demand Systems via Graph Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Operators of Electric Autonomous Mobility-on-Demand (E-AMoD) fleets need to make several real-time decisions such as matching available cars to ride requests, rebalancing idle cars to areas of high demand, and charging vehicles to ensure sufficient range.

item.title: Generating Pragmatic Examples to Train Neural Program Synthesizers
item.description: Programming-by-example is the task of synthesizing a program that is consistent with a set of user-provided input-output examples.

item.title: RAPID: Training-free Retrieval-based Log Anomaly Detection with PLM considering Token-level information
item.description: We introduce RAPID, a model that capitalizes on the inherent features of log data to enable anomaly detection without training delays, ensuring real-time capability.

item.title: Weakly-supervised Deep Cognate Detection Framework for Low-Resourced Languages Using Morphological Knowledge of Closely-Related Languages
item.description: We train an encoder to gain morphological knowledge of a language and transfer the knowledge to perform unsupervised and weakly-supervised cognate detection tasks with and without the pivot language for the closely-related languages.

item.title: Language-guided Robot Grasping: CLIP-based Referring Grasp Synthesis in Clutter
item.description: To address these limitations, we develop a challenging benchmark based on cluttered indoor scenes from OCID dataset, for which we generate referring expressions and connect them with 4-DoF grasp poses.

item.title: Linear Gaussian Bounding Box Representation and Ring-Shaped Rotated Convolution for Oriented Object Detection
item.description: On the other hand, current rotation-sensitive feature extraction methods based on convolutions can only extract features under a local receptive field, which is slow in aggregating rotation-sensitive features.

item.title: Cross-modal Prompts: Adapting Large Pre-trained Models for Audio-Visual Downstream Tasks
item.description: This mechanism leverages audio and visual modalities as soft prompts to dynamically adjust the parameters of pre-trained models based on the current multi-modal input features.

item.title: Conic10K: A Challenging Math Problem Understanding and Reasoning Dataset
item.description: Since the dataset only involves a narrow range of knowledge, it is easy to separately analyse the knowledge a model possesses and the reasoning ability it has.

item.title: Counter-Empirical Attacking based on Adversarial Reinforcement Learning for Time-Relevant Scoring System
item.description: To establish such scoring systems, several "empirical criteria" are firstly determined, followed by dedicated top-down design for each factor of the score, which usually requires enormous effort to adjust and tune the scoring function in the new application scenario.

item.title: POISE: Pose Guided Human Silhouette Extraction under Occlusions
item.description: Human silhouette extraction is a fundamental task in computer vision with applications in various downstream tasks.

item.title: FigStep: Jailbreaking Large Vision-language Models via Typographic Visual Prompts
item.description: Above all, our experimental results reveal that VLMs are vulnerable to jailbreaking attacks, which highlights the necessity of novel safety alignments between visual and textual modalities.

item.title: Counterfactually Fair Representation
item.description: It was shown in \cite{kusner2017counterfactual} that a sufficient condition for satisfying CF is to \textbf{not} use features that are descendants of sensitive attributes in the causal graph.

item.title: PRODIGy: a PROfile-based DIalogue Generation dataset
item.description: Providing dialogue agents with a profile representation can improve their consistency and coherence, leading to better conversations.

item.title: Do Ensembling and Meta-Learning Improve Outlier Detection in Randomized Controlled Trials?
item.description: We began by empirically evaluating 6 modern machine learning-based outlier detection algorithms on the task of identifying irregular data in 838 datasets from 7 real-world MCRCTs with a total of 77, 001 patients from over 44 countries.

item.title: Deep Natural Language Feature Learning for Interpretable Prediction
item.description: We show that the LLM normally struggles for the main task using in-context learning, but can handle these easiest subtasks and produce useful weak labels to train a BERT.
